name: reinject
content:
reinject verb [T]
(LIQUID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to put a liquid or gas back somewhere, especially liquid into a person's body using a needle and syringe (= small tube): The tissue is mixed with white blood cells before being reinjected into the patient's body. After they remove the blood, they filter it before reinjecting it. The contractors were ordered to re-inject the water into the ground.
More examplesFewer examplesThe process involves reinjecting gas into the oil wells.

reinject verb [T]
(SOMETHING LOST)
to put something that had been lost or removed back into a situation or process: The new owners have promised to reinject some life into the business. The author is trying to re-inject idealism into the political process. Related words
inject
injection
reinjection
More examplesFewer examplesThe stunning setting re-injected a sense of ritual and wonder into the occasion.The government has managed to reinject some credibility into the public finances.I want to re-inject a sense of enthusiasm into the study of poetry.
